caption: Socially distanced dining. Absolutely delicious. The chef is truly brilliant and staff attentive.
Absolutely delicious and a neighborhood gem!! Also, Herman is the best and made our night. We’ll definitely be back.

Dine here. I promise you will not be dissatisfied. If you have been to Puglia and know authentic Italian cuisine, you will be transported back to your last visit. Very high quality service and charming, romantic atmosphere. This is worth everything. Come to impress someone or just to spend quality time with your loved ones. You'll enjoy fresh pasta, high quality wine, and luxurious desserts. I enjoyed the papardelle fungi with a side of broccoli Rabe. I will return soon, my friends.
The place is awesome! Great food, fantastic service! Our server German was just a delight. Highly recommend it..
Would surely recommend trying this spot. Fantastic ambience, yummy food, good customer service. Keep up the good work.

Judy (the bartender) is the best bartender in Brooklyn. The food is amazing, the service is spectacular but the drinks are out of this world. Please stop by and and order an espresso martini! The place is amazing but Judy is the reason I visit regularly.
The service is wonderful and the food is great!
I had a great time with my friends yesterday for brunch

This place is my favorite place.  Of all restaurants I know I favor it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to visit this restaurant. Whenever  I want to go to a superb dinner, this place comes straightaway to my head. very good and many types of  food and a rich menu.generous staff, and pleasant ambience. Also important, the cost is reasonable. I tell about this place with no doubt.
Best food you can get in covid times.Just dress warm and ask for a hot toddy  to start.
Excellent and yummy food, I love the atmosphere this place has, and the workers were kind. I will definitely visit here next time.

I ate here for my birthday brunch because it was one of the only places that could accommodate my party of 10 and also be outside. I had a wonderful experience overall. Judy the hostess called me to confirm the reservation and was very friendly and inviting. The brunch menu is pretty basic but still very tasty. It was I believe $28 a person which included a entree and bottomless mimosas. The entire staff made me feel very special for my birthday and even brought out a special drink for everyone to do a cheers to! If atmosphere is important to you definitely give it a try!
I do not recommend. There are much nicer and better places in park slope
Welcoming and the food was wonderful👏

Our brunch exceeded all expectationsb! We had an avocado toast and tagliatelle with truffle oil, both dishes were delicious, and bottomless mimosa is a great deal! Service was very fast, polite and knowledgeable. Also this place is on Seated App which means you can get 19% cash back. Use code “valery14” when register in the app to get extra $5 on your first reservation.
Food was good. Service a bit slow. But overall will return
Service perfect, food very good. A nice neighborhood place.

The food, ambience, staff, and owner are all amazing! What a great tranquil place to get together intimately, or with family and friends. Everything is made with fresh ingredients and the prices are extremely reasonable considering the superb quality. One of my favorite places in all of Brooklyn!

As a local real estate agent I enjoy visiting several food spots in the area and Scottadito is one of them I came across. My go to is the Polipo alla Grigila and the Gnocchetti Di Spinaci.. Absolutely flavorful!
Wonderful neighborhood place that does it perfectly. Even through the Pandemic, they have done everything to maintain a nice establishment for their neighborhood. We had a beautiful night.
Amazing 100%🤩
Good foods, good desserts for ice cream and good lemonade
I got what I expected but not overexcited

A hidden fresh pasta gem in park slope. The staff was beyond amazing for our large party of 10. As a vegan the chef was very accommodating and made me a mushroom plate with truffle oil, so good. My friends really enjoyed the Buffalo mozzarella with prosciutto and figs and balsamic glaze (sweet,salty,savory).
Friendly Personable Staff ..Great Food and Drinks

Very well organised and welcoming restaurant. They provide large portions and for reasonable rates. I enjoyed the meals a lot and the staff members were super personal and informative. Will definitely recommend this place.
The food and service were ahead of my expectations. I really enjoyed the atmosphere of this place. Awesome restaurant to take the family out for lunch.

This charming and rustic restaurant, located adjacent to the Park Slope Food Coop, is unparalleled in Brooklyn and has some of the best Italian food in NYC. The soup is divine, and the chef comes up with vegetable combinations you won't have anywhere else. All soups are dairy-free and plant based. I love the vegetable side dishes and especially the sautéed garlic with zucchini and phenomenal roasted potatoes. Service is absolutely impeccable and the ambiance is wonderful.
Great service and food!
Lovely setting.  Food is consistently fine and reasonable.
Good drinks n food
Loved it
Classic Italian options. It was pretty good. Staff was nice.
An absolutely delicious dinner! Amazing pasta and wine. Looooove the orecchiette especially, as well as the burrata.

Tonight we had reservations for 8pm. Parking was horrible! It took approximately 20minutes to find parking. Got to the restaurant and the hostess was very gracious even though we were approximately 30minutes late. Small and cozy main dining area. The waiter was pleasant and courteous. The food was mouth watering and delectable! The dining experience was worth the hassle of trying to find parking. Kudos to the Chef and staff! It would be an injustice not to mention the bartender. I ordered my favorite drink a cosmopolitan with grey goose citron (even though they did not have any flavored vodka) the mix was smooth and one of the BEST Cosmos I have ever had! Thanks for an excellent dining experience!!! WE SHALL BE BACK!! 💜

Our favorite italian restaurant! My husband and I always try to make it out here when we're in brooklyn. This restaurant is sentimental to us but more importantly, the food here is so so SO amazing. Always a delight to dine here. Also, side note, please don't ever take the bucatini off the menu. My husband's favorite dish, he said it's to die for! We now travel all the way from NJ just for this reason! Much love!

Disclaimer - This is only a review for brunch - I am sure the dinner scene here is a totally different animal.  This place has really gone downhill for brunch. If you're interested in unlimited champagne for basically free then it is great. The food and service, however, has really fallen by the wayside. We had a reservation and the basically seated us in the alcove of the front door which was freezing and very uncomfortable. There were people looming over us the entire time we sat. A server was nowhere in sight, I ended up having to ask the hostess for almost everything we wanted. The coffee was unpalatable. My dining partners needed steak knives to cut their English muffins and the eggs were overdone. I suggested this place based on good experiences I had there a few years ago, I ended up looking like a fool. I'm sure if we were drinking, these flaws wouldn't have been so obvious.  Positives: the breakfast sausage was really delicious and my truffle frittata was also yummy. You can go and not drink - the menu goes down to $16.95 if you don't opt for the unlimited booze brunch. The back room continues to dazzle - it is truly beautiful back there. They also have a small room downstairs for parties/private dinners.
Impressed by this place! Their service was quick and very meticulous! Highly recommend!
Great pasta and their sauce was amazing
Amazing place! So many great occasions celebrated here - birthday, anniversary, New Year’s Eve, all fantastic experiences. Brunch is THE BEST! Great food and excellent service.
Sea bass was delicious
Great food and service
Amazing service and food
Great place. All pastas in white sauce are delicious. The red sauce was ok but no impress me.
It was wonderful, food was delish
Amazing homemade style Italian food. Great atmosphere. Highly recommend.
The food and ambiance was very well received!

Amazing tradition Italian restaurant. Very cozy and warm (with fireplace seating) for a romantic date night. Great wine and cocktail selection. You cannot go wrong with whatever pasta style you decide. Great servers and service. I was greeted immediately and seated in a very romantic corner with lighting and smooth music playing overhead. At the end of the meal I was treated to a delicious lemon vodka shot on the house. I literally cannot complain about this place and I'll be back to try the rest of the menu. BELLISIMO! (I think I spelled that right lol)

Good northern Italian restaurant. I had the Jumbo shrimp it was fresh and very delicious. Also try the pork tenderloin it was really tender not over seasoned just right. The service was top notch great staff.

(Translated by Google) Very good service, very friendly, good price, very rich, highly recommended brunch in Brooklyn!  (Original) Muy buen servicio, muy amables, buen precio, muy rico, muy recomendable brunch en Brooklyn!
Great atmosphere great food great service!
Love this place! Food is great and staff is wonderful, the brunch menu will have you going back at all times
My favorite local Italian restaurant! Best service ever. Great food. Always.
Great pasta, homemade ravioli was excellent.
Great service. Did not feel rushed. Quite tasty
Great place for brunch and dinner
Excellent service. Lovely little restaurant with doors that open wide to let the breeze pass through. The French toast with chocolate and bananas was incredible, too rich for me to finish.
Nice place to go to food is very good
Decent. Expensive and a bit salty. Underwhelming

In the heart of Brookling. Be sure to try the Benedictine eggs. They serve you the brunch (25 dollars) accompanied by champagne or the "mimosa" cocktail. With friends, family or partner ... don't miss it.  The place was crowded, nicely decorated. Waiters very attentive and especially fast, for the crowded place. In the heart of Brookling. Don't forget to try the Benedictine eggs. They serve you the brunch (25 dollars) accompanied by champagne or the cocktail "mimosa". With friends, family or couple ... don't miss it.  (Original) Very good brunch at Brookling - Hay que probarlo  El sitio estaba abarrotado, con decoración agradable. Camareros muy atentos y sobre todo rápidos, para lo concurrido del lugar. En el corazón de Brookling. No dejes de probar los huevos benedictinos. Te sirven el brunch (25 dólares) acompañado de champagne o el cocktail "mimosa". Con amigos, familia o pareja... no te lo pierdas.  The place was crowded, nicely decorated. Waiters very attentive and especially fast, for the crowded place. In the heart of Brookling. Don't forget to try the Benedictine eggs. They serve you the brunch (25 dollars) accompanied by champagne or the cocktail "mimosa". With friends, family or couple... don't miss it.
Great for brunch,quick service, pasta is yummy!
One of my fav brunch spots.  Delicious food and drink.

Really Italian restaurant!! I'm Italian and for the first time in three years I have had a real carbonara, the chef Italian from puglia is a guarantee! Service is very good always in time on the table and very nice approach!  100% suggest!!  Come back at home really happy for my dinner.
Excellent service, great food and ofcourse unlimited mimosas; sat at the bar because we had to wait for table, best choice, Judi was great.
Excellent food, service, and staff
Overall I enjoyed the food and the service. Our table near the door was less then ideal but the wine, burratta and pasta was delish. Would eat hear again.
great brunch deal with unlimited mimosas/champagne!
Old school. Good waiters. Standard menu.

We provided entertainment for a party held in this restaurant and they are great! The staff were very accommodating with our clients requests, the food was delicious, the ambiance was perfect for the party and the restaurant is just a great place to have your special occasion in. Highly recommended!
Delicious food Pleasant decor and ambiance
Best Italian food I've ever eaten in my entire life! And I'm old! Superb service! Next time we're in NYC we're definitely going back there!
The food is great. The people that work their are so nice.

Came here for a party but the food are terrible. Everything had no flavor. The pasta are cold, potatoes wedges are soggy. The salad does not taste fresh. The chicken were burnt and over cooked. Well, on the bright side, the service is good. They really need to Ip their game on the food.
Had big group birthday brunch here.  Great service.  Bottomless mimosa.  Good food. Overall very nice experience.
Beautiful place. The service was outstanding. The food was absolutely wonderful.
Great atmosphere.  Unlimited mimosas for brunch
Great service, great venue. We went on a Saturday and enjoyed some great brunch options! The Grilled Toast is amazing and they also had unlimited champagne! Perfect spot to catch up with friends.
Atmosphere was nice, food was ok. I got the Ravoli.
Had an Easter brunch. It’s a pretty standard $24.95 rate for a meal and unlimited mimosas or champagne. But the food is GREAT. The tagliatelle is amazing!
Great service
Food and atmosphere is great. Some of the portions are small. Enjoyed personal pizzas with a friend and it was amazing.

I would love to give 5 stars, but after we were given our menus and water, it was about 20 minutes before anyone came back around to check on us and take our orders. After that, they checked on us like normal. The restaurant has a warm atmosphere and the food was delicious. Perfect creme brulee!
Great local restaurant food and service terrific
The food is pretty good for what you pay. Better ingredients and cuisine, though, at Terre/Albero Panini.

The waiters are extremely well informed about what goes into each dish so that they can accomodate food allergies and provide gluten free options.  The atmosphere is welcoming and they were quick to adjust tables to suit the elderly in our party.  The food is impressive and delicious.  However the music is a little bit too loud to comfortably hold conversations.
Excellent food and judy was great!!
The food was fantastic! And the service was great.  I'll definitely be coming back.

I recently hosted a celebration brunch at Scottadito Osteria Toscana, with 40 adults and 10 babies, and it exceeded my expectations. I had checked out a few places in the area to host this party, and it didn’t take long for me to realize that Scottadito blew away the competition, in terms of the beautiful space, menu, service, and cost.  From start to finish, every person I dealt with to plan the party was professional, patient, knowledgeable, and made the process entirely stress-free for me (special shout-out to the delightful bartender, Judy, and super personable owner, Donald). The day of the party, the atrium room was set up beautifully when I arrived almost two hours prior to the start of the brunch (thank you, Sam!), and it was a perfect space for my guests to mingle before being seated for the plated brunch. Dino, the awesome head waiter, and the entire wait staff were extremely attentive, ensuring everyone’s glass was topped off, while not being intrusive. Superb service all around.  And then there was the food… I was able to choose three entrees for everyone to enjoy. You read that right — everyone was plated all three entrees. I chose the Uova Fiorentino, Pane Dolce, and Gnocchetti di Spinachi. How does a restaurant manage to perfect such vastly different entrees for such a large party? Scottadito pulled it off and then some. And it was topped off with the most delicious Torta al Cioccolato Cake. My friends couldn’t stop gushing about how impressed they were with it all, with one friend telling me that she’s trying to think of a special occasion just so she can host her party there.  If you’re looking to host a party with top-notch food and service, look no further than Scottadito. And even if you’re just looking to have an intimate meal (it’s a great date spot too!) — go to Scottadito!
Delicious and great service!

Very nice came here twice first time was for bday brunch second time was for engagement party in the lower level or basement I guess. For the bday brunch the food was great mimosas were great, cocktails were very good as well but wow the 2nd time I went for engagement the servers didn't serve enough food it felt like they were just teasing us a little this a little that... I felt hungry after like come on....
Had my cousin's bridal shower here.. Great food..Smooth Service
Great food and drinks. The staff are awesome. They will never let your cup get empty. The owner is also really kind.
Nice ambience !
Great food
Always delicious and very friendly staff.

The brunch food was not cooked to order. I think it was prepared the previous day. Everything looked good but had a weird flavor profile. For example, bread was served with a red sauce which you would expect to taste like tomatoes but it was overloaded with olives. Staff was great.

I went here for brunch and loved it. The decor is fabulous, detailed and warm. The staff was great. I was meeting a friend who was running late and the waiter went over how brunch works while I was waiting - they have an unlimited drink option! We went for that and were happy that they didn't just bring you one refill then forget about you. The food was also very good.
Had my birthday party there service was great food was delicious excellent place to go to celebrate
Great atmosphere but food was a little underwhelming
Foods food. Service not

So glad that I found this place. One of my all time favorite boozy brunch discoveries. Located on a busy block in Park Slope this delightful Italian spot doesn't look like your typical boozy brunch establishment at first glance. Beautiful rustic interiors and a live fireplace give the restaurant a pretty classy feel. They even have a lower level which feels like a wine cellar to accommodate private events and large parties.  Brunch is $25 a pop for an entrée and unlimited mimosas or champagne for about 90 minutes. The offerings consisted of a variety of a egg preparations, a few salads, a few types of pasta and some other brunch classics like French toast. I was quite tempted to try out one of the egg based dishes but ultimately decided to go with the spinach gnocchi and was throughly delighted that I did. The house made gnocchi was rolled in a spinach based dough as opposed to a potato based one and it made all the difference when paired with the mimosas as we didn't feel like it was bloating us up. The mimosas themselves were pretty good and our wonderful server Gina ensured that our glasses were always full. They also had a range of brunch cocktails for $5 which looked promising and which I will surely return to try.  All the staff at the restaurant right from the hostess to all the servers were exceedingly friendly and hospitable and they absolutely enhanced an already lovely experience. I will definitely be back here for brunch and for other meals as well.
Awesome place for drinks and apps
Food was ok... the service was exceptional

Buonissimo! I lived in Italy for two years and although that does not make me an expert on Italian cuisine, it does leave a craving for authentic taste. This restaurant definitely hit the spot! From speaking a bit of Italian with the chef to the pleasant conversation I had with the owner and bartender I am pleasantly surprised to find this gem in Park Slope I will be back again A dopo Scottadito Osteria Toscana!
Best food, best service. I go here every chance I get

I came with a group of 12 people, to celebrate an engagement. The food was good -- especially the antipasti -- and the atmosphere was nice. The best part was that they let us sit and drink coffee/dessert/etc for two hours after our meal without hassling us to leave; and gave us free limoncello at the end. All in all it was a lovely experience, and very Italian!
I had an awesome experience. The service was good, the food was delicious. And the decor was beautiful.

Bottomless mimosas for $25. I had a burger which was great but one of those you can't really eat like a burger because it's so big! 😂 Service was great and reservation for a large party would be recommended
Almost everything is either house made or imported from Italy. Very fresh and flavorful.
They said the braised beef was cooked for 8 hrs      maybe 8 mins it was tough
Customer service could use some work and the food was simply average. I don't even remember what I ate to be honest 🤷🏾‍♀️Butvthe atmosphere is great
The service was great and so was the food
Great food and wonderful service. They kept the mimosas filled and did everything with a smile. I highly recommend it. Get the burger, you won’t be disappointed.
Fantastic Italian institution in Park Slope that's great for groups
Saturday brunch was great!

oh I loved this place! everything was delicious. it was pricy but worth it. I got the tagliatelle with brie. my husband for the pork tenderloin. each was magnificent. the cocktails were wonderful and strong. I got the blueberry spritz and the amatetto. my husband got the jalapeno cucumber cocktail. the creme brulee was divine as was the coffee and tiramisu. I will be coming back it was great. the staff was great, attentive, the owner and bartender both came to see how we were as well.
Great bottomless mimosas to kill some time on a Sunday! Service is prompt and friendly, with a great atmosphere! Food is great, and there's a gorgeous garden in the back!
Mimosa’s were super strong and the brunch special was great 25 bucks for a meal and endless drinks🙌🏾 but eggs could have been better
Fantastic atmosphete, service and food. A must do destination for every foodie.
I ate a truly amazing pasta with truffle oil and brie. The waiters were very friendly. We got our food fast. A nice detail that a waiter walked around with a bowl of parmesan and gave to people.
Very good brunch!

Their brunch special of bottomless and a meal was only 25$ a great deal. I’ll let these pictures make your mouth water a little. Will start off with the amazing staff they have and the service which was excellent. The food was delicious and it just looks good. Look at those pictures haha. Well, i ordered the egg Benedict and my gf order their special burger. The egg perfectly cooked and as soon as you put your knife, the yolk starts running down. It comes with a lovely homemade fries and salad. the burger was probably the best thing on the menu. The mixture of veal, pork and beef gives a wild taste to the burger but at the same time really delicious. My gf doesn’t like beef but she loves the burger. It comes with avocado, cheese and bacon and sunny side up. Both of these meals were included with the meal. Go and enjoy the food there 🤤🤤
I was there for a private event, but I must say that I was impressed both with the food and the service.
Amazing, bright, airy space. Really great bottomless brunch specials:)

If you're looking for a place to stop while traveling up/down I5 in the middle of nowhere, stop here and you won't be disappointed.  You have your choice of sit down restaurant, deli or bar and bar food.  Huge gift shop with tons of snacks. Been here a few times, and whenever we eat here, the food is always good, the portions are large and the service is good.
Foods are good

We always stop here on way to Bay Area . Good deli sandwiches. They need a pizza oven and the place would be packed. It is packed in summer but winter was quite slow on a Friday night -- get that wood fired oven!!!

Came here for breakfast on a long road trip and it was the perfect pit stop! Service was good and the food was even better. I got chicken fried steak and my partner got hash and we were both very pleased. We left with full, happy stomachs and will most definitely return on our next road trip.

The pastas were very smooth and delicious. Can't say the same about the pizza thing. The one we got was a little much on the salt and less in other seasoning.  The sangria was nice. I didn't like the table we were sitting at - could see the inside of the kitchen. But good service otherwise.
Truly bottomless happy hour, really catered to the needs of my 10 person brunch!
Amazing food and even better service... we gave them every reason to hate our group (unintentionally) but they were still super attentive and pleasant.
Chef Rafa (Rafael) is an amazing cook! His hanger steak (their meat is grass fed) melts in the mouth and the tagliatelle Al Brie is just divine! Make sure you go there while he's cooking!
Wonderful Italian food. Wish the back was open earlier.
What a wonderful restaurant. Ambiance, exquite food, warm, friendly, quality service. So glad we came here!
Great Calamri, sauce isn't quite as good as mom makes but not many places can pull off Italian cooking better than your mom.

We love Scottadito. Honestly, it is our go-to... Unfortunately, last time we were there, some of our dishes were not as good as what we were used to. The filet mignon was not cooked properly. The steak was ordered rare and came out medium and not at all hot. We think, it was probably cooked correctly, then put under a heat lamp and it overcooked. What annoyed me the most was the chef came over and argued with us about the steak. He said it was rare.It was NOT RARE! It was brown. Not rarem Who argues with a customer? The Caesar salad was watery as was the pizza.  Off night?

It's an Italian restaurant in Park Slope Brooklyn New York. Very cozy dining experience. Had their Brunch special for $25 with unlimited Champaign or Mamousa. Great deal. Food was great. Have outdoor seating. May have to call to book a reservation. #HELOfood
Good time and service as always
excellent

the food was delicious and the service was excellent.

I highly recommend this place. Brunch is delicious and unlimited drinks are great. Best deal around.
Good food, good service and good price
Great food.  The wine cellar was very cozy.

Delicious food, wonderful atmosphere, wonderful staff. Go to Brooklyn and make this your 1st stop!
Wonderful!!!
It is a very cozy restaurant.  We love the food.  The owner, chef and staff are very attentive.  Great place even for special occasions.
Nice place for authentic Italian food
Awesome place for dinner!
nice interior, tasty food, good service. 👍🏻
Hey this is Miriam from the Balabusta Brooklyn Agency saying Hi and I always walk by your place and I hope one of these days to come over soon and visit you :) I love the place.
Wonderful meal! The staff is very attentive and the chef! Bravo! Such pride is taken in all he does!
Amazing food! Had my father's birthday there a few yrs ago and my baby shower there this year. Service is great and they made each event special.
They’re not bad, the food is somewhat ok.

Incredible food, incredibly good service. We’ve been here twice on two visits to New York for bottomless brunch. Very reasonable with amazing food and refills constantly. It’s WELL worth the trip across to Brooklyn if staying in Manhattan. Will go again for sure!
I love the food and the staff. Its good eats.
Great food, great service
First off, fireplace in middle of establishment. Great food, great wine and awesome coffee! The prices are reasonable for a park slope eatery. Give it a shot,  you'll be highly impressed

Very nice inside with great decorations. They have a nice big open room in the back of the restaurant with plants and a great atmosphere, or up front where you can see the street in a smaller area that still gives you plenty of room. The service is attentive and nice. The food is good, not amazing, but very solid.

By far the worst service I have ever gotten at any restaurant.  The waitress clearly wasn't up to the task which would normally be fine but she was also rude.  The food was okay but I still wouldn't recommend this place to anyone

Typically this is a neighborhood staple as far as brunch goes, but today I had a bad experience. We were a party of 4 and waited 15 minutes for our server to even come to the table and an hour for food after the order was placed. The server came to our table at innapropriate times and couldn’t remember the orders... she was hanging around the bar with other restaurant staff and we spent the whole meal waiting for her to come back or looking for her. Totally unacceptable since the restaurant wasn’t even crowded. Food was good, service was horrible.
100% fantastic food. Sunday brunch was delish. Want to go back for dinner.

What a fantastic brunch experience. The staff was super nice and friendly, eager to serve us. Our server was extremely pleasant and made sure our glasses were full the entire time, even if I only had taken one sip. The bottomless brunch is a spectacular deal. Here we have the Nutella banana French toast which was very delicious and filling, and the fried eggs with potatoes and side salad which was light, well cooked and very fresh. The interior is well decorated and charming with great vibes and it feels very spacious. Highly recommended!!
My wife and I love this spot. Harder to find in the winter but its right next to the firehouse. Delicious food. Affordable prices. Really great lunch specials.
Very nice service

This place is amazing! The food was incredible (we had the veal/pork burger special and french toast) and the service was amazing too! The hostess and Judy our bartender made us feel so at home, can’t wait to come back and try more delicious meals !
Good service, bland food.
I think this place has genius chef. This place became one of my all time favorites in NY. Realy nice environment and helpful staff, wonderful staff I may say.
Saturday  Brunch
Great brunch with unlimited champagne, amazing wait staff and hostess. Will be back again for dinner.

Such a great experience here at Scottadito. The food was phenomenal with great service to match. My wife and I were eating and I had a drink and she didn't since she was pregnant and they brought her a mocktail on the house. Such attention to guests is not found often.If you come here you must try some of their fresh pasta, you won't be disappointed. Will be coming back here maybe sooner than later.

Warm and cozy place with very good food, nice  ambiance and a full bar. Very prompt and attentive service despite being crowded on a bitter cold winter Saturday evening. Interesting menu items and many unique specials. Portions were good, too. Everyone in our small group enjoyed all the appetizers and entrees we shared. Our second time there and we'll be going back!

My favorite Italian in all of Park Slope. Great cocktails, fantastic food and staff. The owner is very friendly and welcoming. They are also very accommodating with their menu if you have any allergies/sensitivities.
Service was excellent even though it was New Year's Day, and they had been open all night.  Tasty brunch with all you can drink Mimosas.
Excellent brunch destination. $25 gets you a delicious Italian brunch with unlimited mimosas. Their coffee and service is excellent.
The food wasn't bad. Place was ok.
Excellent pizza and very good crostini!!!

One of the best restaurants in Brooklyn. The food is awesome, the staff makes you feel at home, the Chef is creative and his food is absolutely delicious. the Owner is genuine and gracious; he is a sweetheart; so is his entire family. Sammy is the best; poised, with such a flair. If you have never been there, you owe it to yourselves to go; you will have a wonderful dining experience. We've told all of our friends about this place. I have never had an ordinary meal there. Everything tastes so good. You deserve a treat. My husband and I loves to get away and enjoy their food. My Grandmother was a chef, and I know good food when I taste it!
Had a great brunch. Champagne and eggs Benedict. Tried a couple of pasta dishes. Insanely amazing
Favorite brunch & lunch spot in NYC!
Nice place and good service. Deserted could be better.
Excellent restaurant. Love their pasta dishes. The brunch special. Outstanding
Cozy Italian restaurant with private room for showers, receptions etc. in trendy Park Slope location.
Had a wonder private family dinner event in the wine cellar.  The food and service is absolutely outstanding!  I highly recommend this restaurant and look forward to coming back.
My favorite brunch in Brooklyn.
I ordered the "whole branzino" and it was the size of a sardine for $32 dollars.   The sangria, mostly fruit and ice.  With tip, blew $55 dollars.  I'm just as hungry as when I went inside.
Food is excellent! Their mimosas are the best (guess what, mimosas are unlimited) 😉
Mimosas =A1!

The food was DELICIOUS.  Chicken parm and pene done to  al dente perfection.  The restaurant warm and cozy with beautiful decor.  The wait staff was attentive and friendly.  However, what impressed me most was when the owner came up to our table, shook our hands and asked us how our dinner was.  That was the personal touch which added to the experience.  I will definitely go back for more.
Solid italian food in the middle of South Beach
Very accommodating to our large party. Excellent service and great brunch choices. Neverending mimosas were a huge hit.
Nice!
Great food, wine and cocktails for both brunch and dinner. Cozy fireplace that's on in the colder months, and a nice sunroom for the summer. Probably my top Italian place in the neighborhood.
Had a work event here. I love the wine cellar. It was great for a secluded party event. Food was great. Service was fantastic!  Nothing bad to say at all.
Great atmosphere, good and affordable wine menu.
Nice place food was good
Great place, great food, Amazing service. Thank you!!
A fantastic place to relax and enjoy quality italian food. The pasta is fantastic and the atmosphere can be romantic.
The food was great and the waiter and waitress were very attentive and polite
Amazing food and service.  A neighborhood gem!
Everything they touch tastes magical ✨
(Translated by Google) Very good restaurant, warm decoration and smiling service, Gracie.  (Original) Très bon restaurant, décoration chaleureuse et service souriant, Gracie.

Sunday brunch is great, although their menu can be limited, the dishes are delicious. They serve unlimited mimosa and champagne and they are great.  My boyfriend ordered a sandwich and the portions were huge. I ordered one of their pasta and it was so delicious, to the point I used my bread to wipe the extra pasta sauce. You must try it.
Good service,  but food was just ok. Calamar app and seafood dinner was very bland.
Sunday brunch was really good and affordable. One set price of any brunch entree which includes unlimited mimosas, champagne, coffee, and tea!

Excellent food with excellent service in a cozy atmosphere. Next door to FDNY Squad 1. If you're looking for a tell you Italian food soaked in tomato sauce this is not the place. Gluten free selections available.
Hosted an event here and the staff was wonderful
Brilliant food and service!
Pretty good.
Good value. Very good food.  Unlike many restaurants,  the chef doesn't over season dishes.  Hangar steak is delicious.
Great food and service. My wife and I frequent this restaurant often and always have a nice evening. Food is creative and we'll done. Service is attentive but not annoying. Highly recommend.
(Translated by Google) The best burata and many delish dishes  (Original) The best burata and many delish dishes
Best food,  best people,  best service
Great pasta served with friendly service.
Beautifull rusting setting with warm staff and  tasty menu .
Wine disappointing and seefood fettuccine far too salty... nothing to see with Italian quality food
A favorite restaurant in Park Slope. Quality ingredients, always delicious. The burrata appetizer special is always worthwhile to order

Solid food. The chicken with Italian sausage was wonderful. The drinks weren't great for an old-school Italian spot; this is where you should get a great old fashioned or Manhattan. But food-wise, it's a winner.

Took my boyfriend there for his birthday.   We both absolutely loved it. I Had fettuccine with seafood in a light saffron sauce, he had the  ravioli with meatballs. Atmosphere and service was top notch.  We will definitely go back
For around 23$ you get all you can drink (limited variety) plus a great dish.  Well worth the money.  Friendly and active wait staff.

We always love going here with our kids. The atmosphere is warm, with a unique setting - used to be part of the fire house. The service is friendly and the food is always excellent and fresh. I especially like the Salmone Scottadito. Every once in a while we are surprised with a complimentary house-made Limoncello after dinner!

One of my friends attended his friend's wedding reception there in 2015. He said he had a great foods and time there. He said he especially enjoyed the complementary tasting of foods. It is located in Park Slope area of Brooklyn, and teh subway station is not too far. My friend and I visited there last week. We really enjoyed the ALL YOU CAN DRINK MIMOSAS OR CHAMPAGNE FOR BRUNCH. I was told this brunch special ($19)  is very popular (naturally!). The service was very good and our glasses were filled frequently. The ambience of the place was also very good. This is a very good place for spending very relaxing hours with friends.  For the brunch, I had the Gnocchetti di Spinachi (pasta), which my friend recommended. It was very good. (although I had to add a little bit of salt).  They had Manhattan quality with Brooklyn price.  I highly recommned this place. *****
This is my favorite brunch spot in Park Slope because of the free mimosas or champagne with your meal. Delicious food as well.
Great food, great atmosphere,  service is great  highly recommend this place!!
20 dollar brunch with all you can drink mimosas or champagne. Great atmosphere and even better food

A surprise on Union ( next to the food coop). The place is simple, and simply delicious. Why? Because there are real Italians there in the front  of the house as well as the kitchen. Staff was very helpful and wine wise. The menu was well thought out. We had the special lamb shank and pasta with meat balls ( very southern Italian ). The chef is from Bari. All in all a pleasant place for an excellent repas.
Amazing unlimited brunch !
Very good!!

The only reason I want to give 2 stars is because of my entree. The banana Nutella gelato and spaghetti was fine. However, my entree which was the Paparedelle al Funghi tasted weird. It has an awful after taste and it was also rubbery. I told the waiter who was very helpful and kind that I didn't like it. He asked me if I would like anything else but I kindly declined. What bothered me was getting the check to see that I have to pay for something I took 1 bite of. That didn't seem fair maybe a price reduction would have been nice. A manager speaking to me would have also been nice. At the time I didn't want to complain but it still bothers me to pay for something I didn't eat.

Love this place. It's a beautiful locale with a rustic cute atmosphere. The back area it's lovely as it looks into the small garden. I've only been here for brunch but the food has always been great. Their pasta is homemade and their bread basket is lovely with a tomato based sauce on the side. Great place for a classy brunch in the slope.
I came here to brunch two times and it was a great time both times. Not only is the food delicious but the unlimited mimosas are definitely the cherry on top. The service is pretty good.
Nice, very attractive space. Try to sit by the fireplace on a cold night. Food was excellent as was the service, but they weren't very bust the night we went, so your experience may vary.

I came here last week with 14 others to have my mother's 70th birthday lunch. This place was wonderful. The manager and the owner were in constant communication with me before the event to make sure everything went off without a hitch. My family was so surprised how great, yet light the food was considering Italian food is usually very heavy. Everything that was served to use from the event prixe fix menu was so delicious. I look forward to coming back again!
Just an amazing northern italian restaurant.  Don't ever pass this place by!

My daughter found this adorable restaurant for her wedding reception. They accomodated us with the entire bottom floor. We entered and the table was set and the room was entirely ours. . Everyone was amazed at how adorable this place was. The food is beyond delicious and so is the service. Price was beyond reasonable. I can not recommend this place enough. Have to say the food was so "CLEAN". Having many guest who were Gluten free and vegetarian they really made it so everyone had a delicious meal! Thank you so much Scottadito Osteria Toscana

We celebrated my husband's 70th birthday at Scottadito in the wine cellar with 35 friends and family.   The food and service were great.   During the planning phases of the event I also received a lot of good advice and assistance from the manager.   The wine cellar is a lovely room - and the upstairs room which accommodates even more guests is also quite lovely.  I highly recommend this restaurant for events and for every day dining out.

I made reservations here on valentines day thinking this would be a great place to take my girl. We order two of the specials, (Fettuccine seafood for me, Lobster pasta for her), and then wait 1 hour for them to give us food. Meanwhile the bread they gave us tasted like stale cornbread with some weird sauce to go with it that tasted like Chef Boyardee  with Tabasco splashed in it. Worst Italian sauce ever. We finally get our food and its the blandest crap I've ever eaten. For $25+ a meal I expect a little more flavor. Have the chefs ever tasted actual Italian food? Nice Atmosphere, Crap food.
One of the better Brooklyn brunch spots, and at $18.95 for all-you-can-drink including an entree, it's less expensive than most Manhattan alternatives. We love the Eggs Benedict here.
wait staff was super friendly and the food was very food.  didn't wait long for a table and finished every bit of the meal
The decor and food is terrific. Loved the sauce served with the focaccia. Very unique. The service is a bit of a downer but food compensates for it.

This all you can drink brunch option overall fails to deliver. Food is decent - nothing spectacular. On my most recent visit, they tried to charge us each a $6 surcharge because we ordered the frittata of the day. When I questioned this, I was told the menu referred to an omelet of the day but this? This was a frittata! No, it was the exact same thing I had the last time just with different ingredients inside but with a higher pricetag.

The prices were right, the food was amazing, service was top notch, great atmosphere.  Not trendy, very comfortable, I had a veal chop which was HUGE, gf had rabbit sausage w/ seashell pasta, and shared a scallop appetizer.  The carrot soup wasn't great.

The service was great, but coming here for two birthdays (when it first opened and again a year or so later), I just enjoyed the food at other places, like Sette and Sotto Voce. It's a lovely venue and the staff is nice. You also can't beat the mimosas, but food-wise, I'd return to Sette before coming back here.

My husband and I actually wanted to go to the spot across the street because we thought they had unlimited mimosa brunch...they directed us to Scottadito...The brunch was DELICIOUS! The service was great, and the atmosphere was cozy and simple. We'll definitley be back for more than the unlmited mimosa brunch!
